fields.value: Massachusetts Archives Collection. v.235-Revolution Resolves, 1782. SC1/series 45X, Petition of Eleazer Brooks

dsDescriptionValue.value:
Petition subject: Military service

Original: http://nrs.harvard.edu/urn-3:FHCL:13909137

Date of creation: 17820000

Petition location: Lincoln

Legislator, committee, or address that the petition was sent to: Several names from a committee

Selected signatures:

  1. Eleazer Brooks

Actions taken on dates: 1782-02-01,1782-02-01,1782-02-01

Legislative action: Received in the House on February 1, 1782 and resolved and sent for concurrence and received in the Senate on February 1, 1782 and read and concurred and amended and sent for concurrence and received in the House on February 1, 1782 and read and concurred

Total signatures: 1

Legislative action summary: Received, resolved, sent, received, read, concurred, amended, sent, received, read, concurred

Legal voter signatures (males not identified as non-legal): 1

Female only signatures: No

Identifications of signatories: assessors of the town of Lincoln

Prayer format was printed vs. manuscript: Manuscript

Additional archivist notes: Middlesex, continental army, class, gaol, prison, servants, masters, enlistment, execution

Location of the petition at the Massachusetts Archives of the Commonwealth: Massachusetts Archives volume 235, pages 121-124

Acknowledgements: Supported by the National Endowment for the Humanities (PW-5105612), Massachusetts Archives of the Commonwealth, Radcliffe Institute for Advanced Study at Harvard University, Center for American Political Studies at Harvard University, Institutional Development Initiative at Harvard University, and Harvard University Library.
